name: Compliance Framework
description: Comprehensive system of policies, procedures, and controls to ensure covered entities and business associates comply with HIPAA regulations. Includes ongoing monitoring, auditing, and documentation.

name: Compliance Program
description: Designated individual or team responsible for implementing and monitoring compliance with HIPAA. Must report to senior management. Includes compliance officer, compliance committee, and ongoing compliance activities.

name: Designated Compliance Officer
description: Individual or entity responsible for compliance program development and implementation. Must have authority to implement policies and report directly to senior management.

name: Audit Procedures
description: Regular audit procedures to monitor compliance with HIPAA policies and procedures. Includes access logs, system reviews, breach monitoring, and periodic audits of covered entities and business associates.

name: Sanctions Policy
description: Written policy establishing sanctions for workforce members who fail to comply with HIPAA policies and procedures. Includes progressive discipline from warnings to termination.

name: Information System Activity Review
description: Ongoing review of information system activity and access logs to detect unauthorized access, inappropriate use, and potential security incidents.

name: Documentation and Record Maintenance
description: Comprehensive documentation of all HIPAA policies, procedures, safeguards, and compliance activities. Records must be maintained for minimum 6 years.

name: Audit Control Logs
description: Mechanisms to record and examine activities on information systems containing PHI. Audit logs must be maintained for minimum 6 years and reviewed for unauthorized access/activity.

name: HHS Office for Civil Rights (OCR)
description: Federal enforcement authority for HIPAA. OCR investigates complaints, conducts audits (including desk audits and on-site audits), and assesses civil penalties for violations.

name: State Attorney General Enforcement
description: State Attorneys General have concurrent authority to enforce HIPAA on behalf of state residents. Can investigate and pursue civil remedies and penalties.

name: Investigation and Compliance Review
description: OCR investigates complaints filed by individuals or entities. Investigation process includes notification of covered entity, document requests, and potentially on-site inspection.

name: Corrective Action Plans
description: Covered entities must develop and implement corrective action plans when violations are identified. Plans must address root causes and prevent recurrence.

name: Civil Penalties
description: Monetary penalties for HIPAA violations. OCR assesses civil penalties up to $100-$50,000 per violation, depending on negligence level. Maximum aggregate penalties apply.

name: Criminal Penalties
description: Criminal liability for knowing unauthorized disclosure of PHI or obtaining PHI under false pretenses. Includes fines up to $250,000 and imprisonment up to 10 years.

name: Business Associate Oversight
description: Covered entities must monitor and ensure business associates comply with HIPAA through contractual requirements, audits, and corrective actions. Contractual terms must include HIPAA compliance requirements.

name: Required Workforce Training
description: All workforce members accessing PHI must receive HIPAA training covering privacy, security, and breach notification rules. Training must be documented and recurring.
